title: Comedy and Power: Who Gets to Joke About What?
description: Learn Comedy and Power: Who Gets to Joke About What? in one minute.

hook.text: A CEO mocking employees is bullying. An employee mocking a CEO is satire.

buildup.text: Comedy scholars distinguish 'punching up' (mocking the powerful) from 'punching down' (mocking the vulnerable).

twist.text: The debate intensified in the internet age. What's 'punching up' vs 'down' is ambiguous when power dynamics are complex.

climax.text: The best comedians navigate this by making themselves the target â€” self-deprecation works because the comedian holds.

punchline.text: Comedy is a weapon. Its ethics depend entirely on which direction it's aimed.

options: 'Punching up' (mocking the powerful) vs 'punching down' (mocking the vulnerable)
